lead_paragraph: The United States lost for the second time in five days at the World Cup, a 25-15 defeat to Tonga yesterday that left the Americans with little chance of reaching the quarterfinals. The Americans lost to England, the defending world champion, last Saturday. For Tonga, it was only the third victory in its World Cup history. The United States played in stifling heat in Montpellier, France, without center Paul Emerick. He was suspended for five weeks Tuesday for a spear tackle against England. In other matches, Fiji edged Japan, 35-31, and Italy rallied to beat Romania, 24-18.
